text.0: thus in the soma in wild joy the brahman hath exalted thee.
text.1: thou mightiest thunderarmed hast driven by force the dragon from the earth lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.2: the mighty flowing somadraught brought by the hawk hath gladdened thee.
text.3: that in thy strength o thunderer thou hast struck down vṛtra from the floods lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.4: go forward meet the foe be bold thy bolt of thunder is not checked.
text.5: manliness indra is thy might stay vṛtra make the waters thine lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.6: thou smotest vṛtra from the earth smotest him indra from the sky.
text.7: let these lifefostering waters flow attended by the marut host lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.8: the wrathful indra with his bolt of thunder rushing on the foe.
text.9: smote fierce on trembling vṛtras back and loosed the waters free to run lauding his own imperial sway.
text.10: with hundredjointed thunderbolt indra hath struck him on the back.
text.11: and while rejoicing in the juice seeketh prosperity for friends lauding his own imperial sway.
text.12: indra unconquered might is thine thunderer caster of the stone.
text.13: for thou with thy surpassing power smotest to death the guileful beast lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.14: far over ninety spacious floods thy thunderbolts were cast abroad.
text.15: great indra is thy hero might and strength is seated in thine arms lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.16: laud him a thousand all at once shout twenty forth the hymn of praise.
text.17: hundreds have sung aloud to him to indra hath the prayer been raised lauding his own imperial sway.
text.18: indra hath smitten down the power of vṛtramight with stronger might.
text.19: this was his manly exploit he slew vṛtra and let loose the floods lauding his own imperial sway.
text.20: yea even this great pair of worlds trembled in terror at thy wrath.
text.21: when indra thunderer marutgirt thou slewest vṛtra in thy strength lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.22: but vṛtra scared not indra with his shaking or his thunder roar.
text.23: on him that iron thunderbolt fell fiercely with its thousand points lauding his own imperial sway.
text.24: when with the thunder thou didst make thy dart and vṛtra meet in war.
text.25: thy might o indra fain to slay the dragon was set firm in heaven lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.26: when at thy shout o thunderarmed each thing both fixed and moving shook.
text.27: een tvaṣṭar trembled at thy wrath and quaked with fear because of thee lauding thine own imperial sway.
text.28: there is not in our knowledge one who passeth indra in his strength.
text.29: in him the deities have stored manliness insight power and might lauding his own imperial sway.
text.30: still as of old whatever rite atharvan manus sire of all.
text.31: dadhyach performed their prayer and praise united in that indra meet lauding his own imperial sway.
